content: What have you done that is so meaningful, or do you just go around belittling people and their work? The robot was a personal project I put on the Instapainting Blog. If you actually looked into it you’ll see that not only are we not using it for anything than a cool demo, it actually requires an artist to paint on it. As far as the Chinese artists and their “meaningless” work, what does it matter to you that people will pay for such “meaningless” work and artists in China are willing to do it? Is it meaningless because they are Chinese, or that they are in China? I’m sure the factory workers in China don’t find much meaning in assembling your electronics, yet you probably happily paid for one anyways. I don’t think it’s anyone’s place to judge what type of artwork is “meaningless.” Some people want their photos turned into hand-painted paintings. I don’t think you’re doing anyone a service belittling the livelihoods of the artists in China, or questioning the motivations of the people who want such a product. After all, I can’t fathom why anyone would want a Android phone but you don’t see me going around belitting the manufacturers or the people who buy them.
